items.title: ‘I can’t stop thinking about money’: I’m struggling with guilt over my $135K in financial mistakes. How do I move on?
items.description: “We aren’t in debt outside of our mortgage, but I feel sick when I think about the money.”

items.title: I’m 58, divorced and will retire at 60 with $5,300 a month. Is now a good time to buy a house?
items.description: “Due to my two divorces, I had to leave the homes I bought and give up all the equity.”

items.title: The fourth quarter’s biggest and best surprise for bulls could be an energy-price dividend, reckons Bank of America’s Michael Hartnett
items.description: An easing of tensions in the Middle East may reduce the risk premium currently built into oil prices,

items.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber, the most successful Broadway composer ever, on why he never invests in his own shows
items.description: The composer of “The Phantom of the Opera,” “Cats,” “Evita” and many others, is enjoying a new — and busy — chapter in his decadeslong career

items.title: What the new 2026 tax brackets mean for Roth IRA conversions
items.description: There are a few simple steps to calculate if taking money out of your IRA is worth the tax bite.
